title: Homemade Kale Chips & Spicy Miso Dip
directions: 1. Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Place kale on two cooking sheets lined with aluminum foil. Drizzle with Tamari and sesame oil, and sprinkle with garlic powder and chili powder or cayenne pepperÂ adding more if you prefer more spice. Bake for 20 minutes or until crisp, rotating pans halfway through. Remove from oven and cool to allow chips to crisp up.
2. In a small mixing bowl, whisk mayonnaise and miso paste to incorporate. Stir in green onion. (Dip can be kept refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a week.)
ingredients: 8 packed cups kale, stems removed, torn into chip-size pieces
1/2 teaspoon chili powder or cayenne pepper
1/2 cup olive oil mayonnaise or veganaise
1 tablespoon red or white miso paste
2 tablespoons thinly sliced green onion, cut on the bias
